metadata.title: CVE-2013-2632 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Google V8 before 3.17.13, as used in Google Chrome before 27.0.1444.3,allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) orpossibly have unspecified other impact via crafted JavaScript code, asdemonstrated by the Bejeweled game.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2632` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 28.0.1500.52-0ubuntu2
chromium-browser-l10n - 28.0.1500.52-0ubuntu2
chromium-chromedriver - 28.0.1500.52-0ubuntu2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 28.0.1500.52-0ubuntu2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 28.0.1500.52-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '28.0.1500.52-0ubuntu2').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
